critique: This document pertains to the classification and consolidation of post offices. It extends civil service rules to free-delivery post offices and addresses the status of employees when offices are consolidated. There's no clear indication of ideological bias, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It seems to grant the Postmaster-General some authority in assigning positions, but this doesn't necessarily represent a significant expansion of executive power. The document appears neutral regarding federalism, economic regulation, and social inclusion. Therefore, most scores should be close to zero.
